medium: Ink, colors, and gold on silk
title: The Exalted Emperors and The Gods of the Five Directions
text: This scroll bears an inscription identifying the figures in the painting as "the exalted emperors Tuufuu (god of the earth) and the Gods of the Five Directions." The chief figures are all dressed in formal court robes and hats descending from heaven with perfect Confucian decorum.
description: ten standing figures, each holding a fan (?) except two figures at top- one holds a scroll, other holds staff; green and blue ground; gold frame; glazed with plexiglass
creditline: The Ruth Ann Dayton Chinese Room Endowment Fund
